alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:17AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank and southeastern Currituck Counties through 1100 AM EDT... At 1016 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Old Trap, or 10 miles southeast of Weeksville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Old Trap around 1025 AM EDT. Grandy around 1030 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Jarvisburg, Frog Island, Powells Point, Poplar Branch, Texas, Glen Cove, Bertha, Goose Creek and Mamie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck
